metadata.title: CVE-2016-10507 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Integer overflow vulnerability in the bmp24toimage function in convertbmp.cin OpenJPEG before 2.2.0 allows remote attackers to cause a denial ofservice (heap-based buffer over-read and application crash) via a craftedbmp file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-10507` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libopenjp2-7 - 2.2.0-1
libopenjp2-tools - 2.2.0-1
libopenjp3d-tools - 2.2.0-1
libopenjp3d7 - 2.2.0-1
libopenjpip-dec-server - 2.2.0-1
libopenjpip-server - 2.2.0-1
libopenjpip-viewer - 2.2.0-1
libopenjpip7 - 2.2.0-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openjpeg2 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.2.0-1').
